org.ftccommunity.org.ftccommunity.ftcxtensible.robot

Class ExtensibleGamepad

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ftccommunity.org.ftccommunity.ftcxtensible.robot.ExtensibleGamepad
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    @Alpha
public class ExtensibleGamepad
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Closeable
    The extensible Gamepad, based on Gamepad. This takes care of multiple issues of the design of the original Gamepad, including code readablity, design, and extending the capabilities of what the Gamepad can do.
    Since:
    0.1
    Author:
    David Sargent

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ExtensibleGamepad.Dpad
      An representation of a gamepad's D-Pad control
      static class  ExtensibleGamepad.Joystick
      The Joystick for use in ExtensibleGamepad.
      class  ExtensibleGamepad.PlainJoystickScaler 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ExtensibleGamepad()
      Setup a basic gamepad; be sure to call updateGamepad(org.ftccommunity.org.ftccommunity.ftcxtensible.robot.RobotContext, com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.Gamepad) to make this safe to use
      ExtensibleGamepad(RobotContext ctx, com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.Gamepad gp)

        Setup a basic gamepad; be sure to call updateGamepad(org.ftccommunity.org.ftccommunity.ftcxtensible.robot.RobotContext, com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.Gamepad) to make this safe to use

      • setupJoystickScalers

        public ExtensibleGamepad setupJoystickScalers(JoystickScaler left,
                                              JoystickScaler right)
        Add scaler algorithms to modify the joystick input
        Parameters:
        left - a JoystickScaler with a custom scaler to use on the left Joystick
        right - a JoystickScaler with a custom scaler to use on the right Joystick
        Returns:
        this object to continue work on

      • updateGamepad

        public void updateGamepad(RobotContext ctx,
                          com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.Gamepad gp)
        Updates this to the status of the provided Gamepad (recast this from a Gamepad)
        Parameters:
        ctx - the Robot Context (nullable, depending on the given JoystickScaler)
        gp - the Gamepad to cast into

      • startRecording

        public void startRecording(java.lang.String name)
        Starts a recording session for the gamepad, updates will only be made whenever updateGamepad(RobotContext, Gamepad) is called, and each call gets a new record
        Parameters:
        name - the unique and case-sensitive name of the Gamepad Record for later reference

        Stops the recording session and saves the recording session

      • startPlayback

        public void startPlayback(java.lang.String name)
        Starts a playback for the specified gamepad recording, this can be called multiple times without any effect
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the the gamepad record

      • stopPlayback

        public void stopPlayback()
        Stops the playback of the gamepad

      • isPlayingBack

        public boolean isPlayingBack()
        Checks if the gamepad is playing back data, or is getting its data from elsewhere
        Returns:
        true if the gamepad is replaying a previously recorded session, otherwise false is returned

      • isFromDriverGamepad

        public boolean isFromDriverGamepad()
        Checks if the gamepad data is being streamed from the driver station
        Returns:
        true if the data is coming from the driver station, otherwise false

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Closes the gamepad and release any system resources it holds.

        Although only the first call has any effect, it is safe to call close multiple times on the same object. This is more lenient than the overridden AutoCloseable.close(), which may be called at most once.

        Specified by:
        close in interface java.io.Closeable
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
